introduction: Test data for demonstrating the NEW tag fade effect with resources at different weeks on list values.

resources.title: Week 1 Resource - Should have bright red NEW tag with pulse
resources.blurb: This resource should show a bright red NEW tag with pulse animation.

resources.title: Week 2 Resource - Should have orange-red NEW tag, no pulse
resources.blurb: This resource should show an orange-red NEW tag with reduced opacity.

resources.title: Week 3 Resource - Should have orange NEW tag
resources.blurb: This resource should show an orange NEW tag with further reduced opacity.

resources.title: Week 4 Resource - Should have dark orange NEW tag
resources.blurb: This resource should show a dark orange NEW tag with more reduced opacity.

resources.title: Week 5 Resource - Should have purple NEW tag
resources.blurb: This resource should show a purple NEW tag with low opacity.

resources.title: Week 6 Resource - Should have gray NEW tag (very faint)
resources.blurb: This resource should show a very faint gray NEW tag.

resources.title: Week 7 Resource - Should have NO NEW tag
resources.blurb: This resource should show NO NEW tag as it's beyond the 6-week threshold.

resources.title: Week 10 Resource - Should have NO NEW tag
resources.blurb: This older resource should show NO NEW tag.

risk_scores.90_100: Excellent coverage - comprehensive solutions addressing this risk area
risk_scores.75_89: Strong coverage - solid approaches with room for minor improvements
risk_scores.60_74: Good coverage - adequate solutions with some gaps or limitations
risk_scores.45_59: Fair coverage - partial solutions requiring additional measures
risk_scores.30_44: Limited coverage - minimal approaches to this risk area
risk_scores.0_29: Weak coverage - insufficient attention to this risk area

coverage_indicators.not_covered: This risk area is not specifically addressed by this resource

analysis: Test data demonstrates NEW tag fade progression across different weeks_on_list values.
Week 1 should show bright red with pulse animation, progressively fading through orange, dark orange, purple, and gray.
Resources beyond week 6 should show no NEW tag at all.
This allows testing of the gradual fade implementation.
